message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the purchase of my product with you. I think it's a fantastic opportunity for you to get your hands on a unique and valuable item. I'm willing to offer it to you for $11000.

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, Alice. I'm interested in making a deal, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. I believe it's a fair price considering the market value and what I'm willing to pay.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your perspective, but I'm not willing to go as low as $9000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $10500. It's a fair compromise that still reflects the value of the product.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $9500, but that's as high as I can go. I hope we can find a mutually beneficial price.

I understand your budget constraints, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer it to you for $10250. This is as close as I can get to your target price while still ensuring I get a fair return on my investment.

I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $9500, as I mentioned before, and I'm not willing to go any higher. I'm hoping we can meet in the middle at $9750.

I understand your persistence, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway. However, I'm still not comfortable selling the product for $9750. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer it to you for $10200. This is as close as I can get to your target price while still ensuring I get a fair return on my investment.
